description:
Originally published by Robert Hooke on November 23, 1664 (NOTE: various sources also cite September 1665 as the date of publication), “Micrographia: Some Physiological Descriptions of Minute Bodies Made by Magnifying Glasses with Observations and Inquiries Thereupon” is a collection of comments & observations made by the author while exploring both manmade and natural objects through the lens of his self-built microscope. Supporting this text are detailed engravings illustrating Hooke's observations.

This webOS adaptation of “Micrographia” is derived from the Project Gutenberg HTML eBook (compiled by Dave Prochnow; whereupon any errors are solely my responsibility).

“Micrographia: Some Physiological Descriptions of Minute Bodies Made by Magnifying Glasses with Observations and Inquiries Thereupon” 

- Complete text
- High-resolution illustrations
- Five enhanced illustrations
- Navigate sections of the book via floating View Menu
- Use enhanced illustrations as wallpaper for your device
